ygData.subject: Re: Root and Shoot
ygData.msgSnippet: Root and shoot is a strategy where you root, stand back out of the creatures range, and nuke till it s dead.  This strategy because almost a must a high lvls.
ygData.messageBody:
Root and shoot is a strategy where you root, stand back out of the creatures
range, and nuke till it's dead. This strategy because almost a must a high
lvls. As for Holly Crosstree she only attacks you if you are attacking an
animal, as does Cris Treewind (i believe that's his name, or something close
to that). You should try BlackBurrow, Paw, or the Karanas if you don't want
to fight around those npc's.

Tandayen, Dark Elf Wizard (who once fiddled around with a ranger in qeynos
:) )


-----Original Message-----
From: Raistlin X <raistlinx76@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, May 07, 1999 10:29 PM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Root and Shoot


>From: "Raistlin X" <raistlinx76@...>
>
>Greetings,
>
>I have heard about this "Root and Shoot" strategy and I am greatly curious
>about what it is. I have all the RANK 2 spells except Glimpse and I need a
>good way to kill things as I am getting nowhere towards my next level
(Level
>7). I currently reside in Qeynos (Human), and I am looking for some way to
>get to Level 7 without getting slain by Holly Crosstree or whatever her
name
>is.
>
>I am also looking to learn some new languages but it's hard to do as I have
>none to trade in return.
>
>So, for those of you are confused, what is thr "Root and Shoot" strategy?
>
>(The strategy I use sometimes is to cast Root then Icestrike, back away,
and
>watch the enemy get pelted, then finish them with my staff when Icestrike
or
>Root ends.)
>
>Raestlin (Raistlin was taken, OK?)
>Level 6 Human Wizard
>Tunare Server (*SNIFF* I miss Veeshan!)
>
